* Represents a command to add a task to the task list.
* Contains the task to be added.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Adds the task to the task list, displays the added task, and saves the updated task list to storage.
* @param ui The Ui object, for displaying the added task to the user.
* @param storage The Storage object, for saving the updated task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents an abstract command that can be executed by Jarvis.
* This class serves as the base class for all specific commands
* Executes the specific implementation of this command.
* @param tasks The list of tasks currently managed by Jarvis.
* @param ui The Ui object to interact with the user.
* @param storage The Storage object to read or save tasks to disk.
* @throws JarvisException If there is any error during the command execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JarvisException;
* Checks if this command should cause Jarvis to exit.
* @return true if Jarvis should exit, false otherwise.

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JarvisException {

* Contains the index of the task to be marked.

* Marks the task as done, displays the marked task, and saves the updated task list to storage.

* Represents an exception that is specific to Jarvis.
* Creates a new JarvisException with the specified message.
* @param message The message to be displayed.
* Represents an exception that occurs when the user provides an invalid index.
* Creates a new JarvisInvalidIndexException with the specified task index.
* @param taskIndex The task index that is invalid.
super("OOPS!!! No such task with index " + taskIndex);
* Represents an exception that occurs when the user does not provide a value for a command.
* Creates a new JarvisMissingValueException with the specified value and command.
* @param value The value that is missing.
* @param command The command that requires the value.
super(String.format("OOPS!!! The %s of %s cannot be empty.", value, command));
* Represents an exception that occurs when the user provides an unrecognised command.
super("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Represents an exception that occurs when the user provides an invalid date time format.
super("Please use the correct date time format: d/M/yyyy HHmm.");

* A Deadline is a task with an additional LocalDateTime attribute to indicate its deadline.

* Constructs an Event object with the specified description, start time, and end time.

* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {

* A completed task is represented by "X", and an incomplete task is represented by a space.

return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
